user: Explain what QLoRA is in simple terms.
assistant: QLoRA is a way to fine-tune a big language model using much less memory. Instead of updating all the model's weights, it keeps the original model frozen and adds a small set of extra weights (LoRA adapters). These adapters are trained in 4-bit compressed form, so you can run training on a single consumer GPU. The end result is that you get a model specialized for your task, but you avoid the huge cost of full fine-tuning.
